intro.title: Nirakara Studio
intro.description: Founded in 2019, Nirakara is a Colombo-based silver house designing objects influenced by South Asian modernism and coastal rituals. We maintain a transparent, slow-production model anchored by local partners.

studio.title: Studio Coordinates
paragraphs: Our workshop overlooks the Kelani River. Proximity to the port allows us to ship worldwide every Wednesday, while the studio remains open for fittings by appointment.
Creative director Suren Dias studied industrial design in Singapore and returned to Sri Lanka to produce jewelry that reflects regional geometry and craft.

production.title: Production Notes
paragraphs: Casting, filing, and finishing are completed in micro-batches. Pieces are packaged in recycled rubber pouches produced by the Ride 4 ReLife initiative.
Each order includes a care log where we document maintenance history during complimentary yearly polishing.

values.title: Local Craft First
values.description: Every collection is fabricated in Colombo or Matara by six goldsmith families we work with year-round.

values.title: Measured Releases
values.description: Drops are capped based on recycled metal available each quarter, avoiding overproduction.

values.title: Transparent Pricing
values.description: We publish material costs and labour hours for our core catalogue so clients know the origin of every rupee.
